oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Record Review Artist Interviews 1982 - E
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recordings of phone interviews with various artists hosted by Al Risen. Recording features: T. G. Sheppard, Leon Everette, Ronnie Milsap, Richard Sterban, and Ricky Skaggs. Item is listed as part E of the 1982 Nashville Radio Review artist interviews.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Al Risen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Al Risen introduces T. G. Sheppard who discusses his excitement with the success of his records -- (00:51) Risen and Sheppard discuss "War is Hell" and compared it to the Summer of 1942 -- (01:53) Sheppard discusses his upcoming touring -- (02:53) Risen radio spot introduction for "War is Hell" -- (02:59) Al Risen introduces Leon Everette, and both discuss the creation of Orlando Records -- (04:04) "Giving Up Easy" is revealed to be Everette's first record with RCA -- (05:15) Everette discusses his successful records -- (05:46) Everette reveals he is about to go on tour with Hank Williams Jr. -- (06:14) Everette discusses the inspiration for "Shadows of My Mind" -- (06:54) Risen radio spot introduction for "Shadows of My Mind" -- (06:59) Al Risen introduces Ronnie Milsap; additionally Milsap demonstrates his 'talking watch' -- (08:27) Risen and Milsap discuss the Glen Campbell Music Show -- (10:15) The horn structure of "He Got You" is discussed by Milsap -- (11:27) Risen radio spot introduction for "He Got You" -- (11:32) Risen introduces Richard Sterban of the Oak Ridge Boys, and Sterban discusses the Oak Ridge Boys' first Christmas album -- (12:47) Eddie Raven is reflected on by Risen and Sterban -- (14:09) Sterban discusses how William Lee sings lead on the new album -- (15:09) Risen radio spot introduction of "Thank God for Kids" -- (15:17) Risen introduces Ricky Skaggs, and "You Put the Blue in Me" is discussed -- (16:06) Risen has Skaggs discuss how he is producing the Whites -- (18:01) Risen and Skaggs discuss how he discovered "I Wouldn't Change You" -- (18:34) Risen radio spot introduction of "I Wouldn't Change You" -- (18:42) Risen introduces Chuck Glaser, and both discuss how the Glaser Brothers discovered their distinctive style -- (21:17) Risen has Glaser discuss the time where the brothers where broken up -- (22:19) Glaser reflects on the first time he heard "Maria Consuela" -- (24:19) Risen radio spot introduction of "Maria Consuela"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Shepherd, T. G.; Sheppard, T. G.; Everette, Leon; Milsap, Ronnie; Milsap, Ronnie, 1943-; Sterban, Richard, 1943-; Skaggs, Ricky; Glaser, Chuck;
